content.question: A student performed a fractional distillation of a mixture of two straight-chain hydrocarbons, <math alttext="C 7 H 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C 8 H 18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using four clean, dry flasks, the student collected the distillate over the volume ranges (<math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) shown in the graph above. Over what volume range should the student collect the distillate of the compound with the stronger intermolecular forces?

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
